data.what_is:
WebEngage is a full-stack Retention OS that simplifies customer engagement for 800+ brands across the globe. The platform enables businesses to build personalized and meaningful relationships with their users across various digital channels. 

With its comprehensive suite of tools and solutions, WebEngage empowers businesses to understand, engage, and retain customers effectively.

- UNIFY CUSTOMER DATA: WebEngage enables businesses to consolidate customer data from various sources, providing real-time insights and allowing dynamic micro-segmentation for targeted campaigns based on specific customer attributes and behaviors.

- MULTI-CHANNEL JOURNEYS: With WebEngage's intuitive drag-and-drop workflow builder, businesses can seamlessly design and automate multi-channel customer journeys, ensuring consistent and personalized experiences across channels such as email, SMS, push notifications, and more.

- TARGETED CAMPAIGNS: WebEngage empowers businesses to automate personalized campaigns triggered by customer actions and predefined business events. This ensures timely and relevant communication to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.

- AI-DRIVEN PREDICTIVE MODELS: WebEngage Analytics dashboard empowers all metrics required to segment, engage and retain priority customers, churn to convert windows and ROI optimization,This allows businesses to focus their interventions and campaigns for maximum impact and better ROI.

- 1:1 PERSONALIZATION: WebEngage enables businesses to deliver personalized experiences at scale. By incorporating user intent, preferences, and other relevant data, businesses can tailor their communications to each individual customer, fostering omni-channel customer engagement.

What's more? WebEngage's platform is quick and easy to integrate. Compatible with range of ESP and MSP, all it takes is a few hours from the tech team.

Presence across the globe:
With headquarters in India, WebEngage has expanded its operations globally with offices and presence in the Middle East & Africa region, Southeast Asia, and South America.
data.product_description: WebEngage is a user engagement and retention platform that helps you unify customer data, execute marketing campaigns, and track performance.WebEngage is uniquely positioned because of its ease of accessibility in gaining customer behaviour and deeply explored use cases that allow to engage orchestrated journeys and capture qualitative retention windows. Along with integration compatibility with products you might already be using.Due to this same reason, brands like Unilever, Adani Group, IKEA, SUGAR Cosmetics, Spinny, and 800+ others work with WebEngage.

initial_reviews.review_title: Excellent Experience While Working On WebEngage Platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The platform is known for its intuitive and user-friendly interface, which makes it accessible even to those without extensive technical expertise. This ease of use can help teams quickly adapt and make the most of the platform's features.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Nothing as such to be honest.
However, the cost sometimes can be high for small businesses or startups with limited budgets.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage addresses several key challenges faced by businesses in customer engagement and marketing.
It consolidates fragmented customer data across platforms into unified profiles, allowing for better personalization. Advanced segmentation tools enable precise targeting, enhancing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Automation features streamline multi-channel campaign management, saving time and reducing errors.
WebEngage also ensures personalized interactions through tailored content and recommendations, improving customer satisfaction and loyalty. Its multi-channel support, including email, SMS, push notifications, and web, provides a cohesive customer experience.
Additionally, analytics and reporting tools offer valuable insights for optimizing marketing strategies.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Marketing Automation Toolkit
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
In our organisation, WebEngage has emerged as a very resourceful tool, it is used daily, particularly because of its robust capabilities in data analysis and creative data visualization. For an employee working in strategy team like myself, the ability to analyze and visually represent data is core to the day to day working. WebEngage excels in this area. The platform offers comprehensive tools for tracking and analyzing the performance of various campaigns across different channels. This has been instrumental in understanding our audience better and tailoring our strategies accordingly. A key aspect of my role involves monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of our marketing initiatives frequently, like on a weekly basis. WebEngage's capabilities in tracking top-performing campaigns and measuring click-through rates have been invaluable. These features provide me with actionable insights, enabling me to implement our approaches for better results. This in turn also helps me to summarise the results of campaigns and present to the top management of the orgaisation.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There are several areas where WebEngage could improve. Firstly, some of the newer features like predictive user segments are still in developent and exhibit bugs, particularly with issues in fetching user lists. customer support responsiveness to our marketing team and the quality of their solutions have been inconsistent, sometimes leading to delays in resolving critical issues. I have also faced high data loading time, which affects operational efficiency, especially when quick data analysis is needed. Lastly our engineering team faced challenges in integration, where I believe straightforward guidance and robust technical support from WebEngage would be more helpful.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage has helped us to identify user behaviour by tracking events in our products, thus helping us to refine our product offerings and provide the promised value to our customers. Personalised campaigns through WebEngage has helped us to identify specific user behaviour, helping us to improve funnel metric, especially Trials to Subs metric for our organisation.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Analytics Tool In Market
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage has a lot of features that are helpful for my organization. The best things that I like about it is the events tracking system, where we can integrate the events in our games to track how users are using our product so that we can identify the pain points and fix them. The other thing that I like about WebEngage is the predictive segments that they recently launched where we are able to predict churn by 95% accuracy and this has helped us winback a lot of users. In my role I have to use the tool every day to see the performance of different journey. It was very easy for us to integrate the tool with our product.
Since the tool is very beautifully built, it's very easy for us to use.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There is not much to dislike about webengage, the only thing that I can think of is that sometime the system becomes too slow for us to use. And also I think the price can also be a bottleneck for many organizations.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage is helping my organization solve a lot of problems from one place itself. We are able to improve our product using the events integrations and using the dashboard to identify the pain points of the user. We are able to send out communications by creating different journeys in WebEngage and keeping track of all the communications. We are able to use the AI to help us reduce churn and also winback lost customers. So all in all it has helped us in all our use cases and we are very happy with the tool.

initial_reviews.review_title: A must have tool for the customer journeys and the cross channel communications
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I could say that It's a good software, I will recommend it if you want to automate customer journey as well as send hyper personalised and cross channel communications. It's easy to integrate. Currently, we are using this to engage our audience. It comes with an excellent feature such as inbuilt analytics where you can check the progress of your campaigns.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The pre-defined email and sms templates are very less in the library, also I found it very difficult to create or use of dynamic templates. The analytics feature can be imporved by using segment level reporting (using funnels).

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
My experience with WebEngane is very good as of now. We have decided to go ahead fully with this tool last year, we started paid our journeys which we were doing manually from quite a long. And guess what, It made our lives very easy by using the it's automation. Now the customer journey is much more systematical and powerful. So in the nut shell, I would like to say that the power of this tool related to customer journey is very strong.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Experience While Working On WebEngage Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The platform is known for its intuitive and user-friendly interface, which makes it accessible even to those without extensive technical expertise. This ease of use can help teams quickly adapt and make the most of the platform's features.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Nothing as such to be honest.
However, the cost sometimes can be high for small businesses or startups with limited budgets.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage addresses several key challenges faced by businesses in customer engagement and marketing.
It consolidates fragmented customer data across platforms into unified profiles, allowing for better personalization. Advanced segmentation tools enable precise targeting, enhancing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Automation features streamline multi-channel campaign management, saving time and reducing errors.
WebEngage also ensures personalized interactions through tailored content and recommendations, improving customer satisfaction and loyalty. Its multi-channel support, including email, SMS, push notifications, and web, provides a cohesive customer experience.
Additionally, analytics and reporting tools offer valuable insights for optimizing marketing strategies.

The best thing about WebEngage is the user interface which makes it very easy for the user to implement the campaign.
WebEngage is full of features that improve customer experience and increase the frequency of usage of our campaign which helps us to reach our users on time.
We can schedule N numbers of campaigns and no campaign gets hampered, and neither does any campaign impact any other campaign.
The customer support system of Webengage is also good which is always there to help us in resolving any issue that occurs during the execution of any campaign on Webengage.
The integration between our Data Science Team information and WebEngage team is also very smooth and each information floats easily as per our demand.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
I'm fully satisfied with the support and features provided by WebEngage and my experience is good so far.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Initially, we used to face many issues like Personalisation not working for the name tag and now we can use the name tag which has increased the CTR by about 62% on app push and about 82% on WhatsApp.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Marketing Automation Toolkit
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
In our organisation, WebEngage has emerged as a very resourceful tool, it is used daily, particularly because of its robust capabilities in data analysis and creative data visualization. For an employee working in strategy team like myself, the ability to analyze and visually represent data is core to the day to day working. WebEngage excels in this area. The platform offers comprehensive tools for tracking and analyzing the performance of various campaigns across different channels. This has been instrumental in understanding our audience better and tailoring our strategies accordingly. A key aspect of my role involves monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of our marketing initiatives frequently, like on a weekly basis. WebEngage's capabilities in tracking top-performing campaigns and measuring click-through rates have been invaluable. These features provide me with actionable insights, enabling me to implement our approaches for better results. This in turn also helps me to summarise the results of campaigns and present to the top management of the orgaisation.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There are several areas where WebEngage could improve. Firstly, some of the newer features like predictive user segments are still in developent and exhibit bugs, particularly with issues in fetching user lists. customer support responsiveness to our marketing team and the quality of their solutions have been inconsistent, sometimes leading to delays in resolving critical issues. I have also faced high data loading time, which affects operational efficiency, especially when quick data analysis is needed. Lastly our engineering team faced challenges in integration, where I believe straightforward guidance and robust technical support from WebEngage would be more helpful.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage has helped us to identify user behaviour by tracking events in our products, thus helping us to refine our product offerings and provide the promised value to our customers. Personalised campaigns through WebEngage has helped us to identify specific user behaviour, helping us to improve funnel metric, especially Trials to Subs metric for our organisation.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Analytics Tool In Market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage has a lot of features that are helpful for my organization. The best things that I like about it is the events tracking system, where we can integrate the events in our games to track how users are using our product so that we can identify the pain points and fix them. The other thing that I like about WebEngage is the predictive segments that they recently launched where we are able to predict churn by 95% accuracy and this has helped us winback a lot of users. In my role I have to use the tool every day to see the performance of different journey. It was very easy for us to integrate the tool with our product.
Since the tool is very beautifully built, it's very easy for us to use.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There is not much to dislike about webengage, the only thing that I can think of is that sometime the system becomes too slow for us to use. And also I think the price can also be a bottleneck for many organizations.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage is helping my organization solve a lot of problems from one place itself. We are able to improve our product using the events integrations and using the dashboard to identify the pain points of the user. We are able to send out communications by creating different journeys in WebEngage and keeping track of all the communications. We are able to use the AI to help us reduce churn and also winback lost customers. So all in all it has helped us in all our use cases and we are very happy with the tool.

all_reviews.review_title: A great tool for Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
In my workplace, WebEngage is a marketing tool that is used daily for marketing-related tasks to data analytics. A user-friendly UI helps with the easy usage and it has been a breeze for new joiners in our team to implement this tool. The feature of sending personalized campaigns has made the work of the marketing team quite easy. Customer support usually replies quite early. The integration of Webengage was successful in just a few weeks which might've taken longer if opted for any competitor tool.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There are certain new features, like predictive user segments which are still under development and are a bit buggy as sometimes we can't fetch the user list.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
There are a few areas where WebEngage has helped our company immensely, one area was the increasing number of Monthly Downloads by users who have already churned earlier. This has only been possible with the help of personalized campaigns. Other than that, we have also made several changes in our user journeys and optimized them to get a significant increase in trial-to-subscription figures.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the most effective marketing tool in the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Best thing about Webengage is that all the platform you will use to market are all integrated in this tool. The best part is that it is very user friendly, and you can personalise the marketing to the users to the very granular level. Lead segmentation is probably the best in this product. You can market using SMS, IVR, Email, Webpush, App push, Onsite notification and what not. It is redefining your marketing. Customer support is good.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The product is too vast, so while its easy to use, you will have to invest time to learn and get familiar with all the tools you can use. Its uses Ml and AI in certain features, which become little technical. Segmentation is one things that you will have to invest time to learn.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is really helping us do the smart marketing and personalising our marketing strategies rather than just doing blanket marketing. Now we can target users on every platform using one single platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Tool for Cost Effective Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I have been using the WebEngage tool for the past 1 year, I come from a nontechnical background and the tool is very user-friendly, you can create communication very easily with ease. The tool helps us to target large audience segments effectively at mass.

1) Under the journey's module there is a feature  "Check Best Channel", under which it identifies which users are most active on which channel, For example, Joey has users who open Email frequently compared to SMS, The Webengage system will target Joey on Email and not SMS. Thereby saving the cost of Marketing on a particular channel.

2) The Customer support team of the WebEngage is very quick and supportive the response we get from the support team is commendable.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The one thing that I personally dislike about the tool is its segment brewing which sometimes takes more time to populate.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Cost-effective marketing was the biggest concern for us. Through WebEngage tool we are able to target large masses of uses at an effective cost because of its numerous feature.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Customer Engagement Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I work at a company where the Marketing team has to launch campaigns almost every single day and send emails to customers and WebEngage comes as an indispensable tool for the entire team. We use it to track user journeys by doing event integration in all of our apps and then with the help of WebEngage Dashboards we monitor our engagements daily. I love how well the documentation of WebEngage has been created, making it easier for people to use the tool effectively. The customer support is quite responsive too.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
I don't have much dislikes to talk about WebEngage because of the benefits it has provided to us over time. The integration took a bit of time but I feel it would have been longer if we went for any WebEngeg competitors.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been facing a lot of issues with our customer engagement due to which our customer retention was lower than the industry average. But with constant efforts with the help of WebEngage we have improved our customer retention significantly. There are other aspects that has helped us with user retention too, like improving the existing product with the help of WebEngage event integrations.

Webengage is a one stop solution for all things marketing. Also, the web personalization features really helps us deliver personalized communication to our customers.

But with the help of Webengage, we are successfully segmenting our customers and targetting with with personalized communication. Also, the web personalization feature is quite good. Helped us in showing personalized content to our visitors.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool but  slightly buggy at times
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I love how easy the integration of the WebEngage was for the entire Backend and SDK team in our country. Although it took a bit of time, it was hugely useful for event tracking once it was successful. Our Data team uses it a lot to gather insights on user behavior and hence helps improve our product by making data-driven decisions. Also, our marketing team uses it a lot to send e-mails to users for their regular engagement with our product and this feature is often used to get reactivations. The frequency of usage in our company is almost daily by the marketing team but as a member of the data team, I use it at least once every two days and but mostly daily.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
In Webengage, there are a lot of new features that are quite buggy and aren't implemented well. For example, the Predictive user segment is a new feature that has been launched by Webengage but it doesn't work well as it fails to load the user list CSV file most of the times. Also, when we try to reach out to the point of contact for Webengage, they are mostly unable to help us in situations like this.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We wanted to know the user behavior to understand how they interact with our product. This is solved by WebEngage and it has helped us improve our product in every new version release.
Another area where WebEngage has helped us is to send emails to churned customers so that they can perform reactivation. This has helped us improve our reactivation number every month.

One of the best features is the user journey creation and the feature where we track user events which helps us improve our product over time. The integration was seamlessly performed by our engineering department and the tool is well implemented across departments like marketing team, data team and product team.

Earlier we struggled to take data driven decisions for our product improvements and our marketing team had to resort to other time consuming methods for user engagement, but with the onset of WebEngage we have significantly improved our business metrics which has created a positive impact on our overall revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: A bit pricey, it performs as needed
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
In our startup, we use WebEngage almost every single day, I have observed that the User journeys that are being tracked are mostly correct and give us a huge advantage by providing insights into how our users engage with our product.

It is very easy to reach out to the WebEngage support personnel, I have personally received a response back even at odd hours.

Also, the backend team in our company seems to be a lot more comfortable with the WebEngage integration in our product helping with easier integration of the product.

The User Interface makes it easier to use the entire WebEngage platform and create dashboards helping us in our daily monitoring of the data.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
In terms of tracking user journeys, WebEngage was a savior. Our organization has tried Proof Of Concepts with other user journey-tracking software but now our team has been comfortable with most of the WebEngage features. We do see some minute discrepancies in the user journey data but our team is being able to handle the disparity in most cases. The data discrepancy usually happens when a particular event is not being tracked. Now this makes it challenging for the team to gather correct insights from the data provided by WebEngage.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage's tracking of user journeys provides significant insights into our users' interactions with our product. This has provided us with a valuable advantage, enabling us to understand user engagement comprehensively. We can then make changes to our product in the upcoming releases accordingly. This has helped us improve our onboarding process.

Furthermore,  WebEngage's integration with our product solves the challenge of backend teams feeling comfortable with the platform. This ensures that our backend team can work more comfortably and use WebEngage at its full potential.

all_reviews.review_title: A Vital Asset for Seamless Campaigns and Data-Driven Insights
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
We now use WebEngage as a necessary tool for all of our everyday tasks. The marketing team uses this software extensively because they are responsible for launching campaigns nearly every day. Although it took some time, our Backend and SDK team was amazed at how simple the connection was. After a successful integration, the event tracking features were quite helpful. It is striking how frequently our staff uses it, particularly the marketing and data teams, demonstrating its everyday relevance. One of our best features is the ability to create user journeys, which helps us improve our user engagement. The automated features of the program greatly improve work management, especially for the marketing staff.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The customer support lacks in appropriate responses at times. Although the documentation of WebEngage tool is quite adept, the need to approach WebEngage customer support isn't needed often.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
For our business, WebEngage has changed everything by tackling important issues with user engagement, data-driven decision-making, and revenue. We've effectively built tailored emails and user journeys by utilizing its features, which has greatly increased engagement and supported our marketing initiatives. A notable improvement in business KPIs has resulted from the simplified data-driven decision-making process, which has a beneficial effect on total revenue. Furthermore, the focus that WebEngage has placed on customisation has helped to gradually raise our average monthly renewal rate, which is in complete alignment with our business objectives. All things considered, it's a flexible solution that has been essential to our success.

all_reviews.review_title: All in One Marketing Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
We have been using WebEngage daily for almost more than a year now and one of the best benefits I have observed is that there are multiple features which can be used for user engagement. One of them is creation of user journeys which can be done very quickly with the help of WebEngage. There was no need to use any third-party tool for any integrations as WebEngage is self sufficient with a lot of features. The interface of WebEngage is fairly interactive which is very easy to get accustomed to it and fairly easy to implement. The customer support is prompt with their responses.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
It would be really great if WebEngage could provide us more flexibility in their subscription plans because for a small company like ours, it becomes very hard to allocate big resources to marketing tools. Although I believe the ROI is quite good, we still feel a pocket pinch due to our company's position.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been struggling to improve our company's revenue for a while and by maximising WebEngage's potential we have created several user journeys, created personalised emails which has helped us improve our user enagement and has been a great help for the entire marketing team.

I have also observed that we have been improving our user retention because of the personalised campaigns that are very easy to create using WebEngage. all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage : Fueling Marketing Success
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
In our startup, we use WebEngage is widely used almost daily in a lot of ways. It is primarily used by the Marketing team and our Data team to make sure our product has the best customer engagement possible. One of the ways we use it is by doing email marketing and launching campaigns. With the help of WebEngage, we have also integrated our apps to track user behaviors by tracking necessary events. This has widely helped us to improve our product with time. I love how accurately WebEngage tracks user journeys, it has a wide range of dashboards for customer analytics where we could track that MAU and DAU. The UI is also very intuitive and doesn't take much time for the new joiners to adapt to it.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
One of the things which I dislike is that WebEngage has assigned a sales representative to our company and that person acts as a point of contact for all the customer support. This chain of communication often delays getting an effective response. Another thing that I feel could have been better is the ease of implementation. Our SDK team faced quite a few challenges with the integration of WebEngage, although once it was successful, it paid us dividends.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage is helping us identify our user's behavior for our product. It also helps us in Marketing with customer journey mapping and automating marketing-related tasks. We have seen a huge impact on the user onboarding process with the changes we made on the basis of the user data we analyzed. Also, WebEngage has helped us improve our monthly user reactivations with the help of several customer journeys and personalised email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Marketing Automation Tool for Startups
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Speaking from working at a startup, I feel WebEngage has the best Startup program. This is a game-changer, especially for startups and smaller players who are looking to harness the power of automation and analytics without significant upfront investment. The on-boarding team makes the integration process very smooth and they even assist you if you are facing any issues.

Their pricing structure is not only reasonable but also tailored to suit businesses of all sizes. This means even smaller players can access premium features without breaking the bank.

Having used other industry leading tools, I feel that WebEnage provides a very user friendly dashboard and anyone can used their advanced tools without any technical knowledge.

The feature which helps me a lot and which is not very common in other industry leaders would be - Check best channel. This features basically analyzes the past behaviour of a user and sends them communication only the channel in which they are most likely to engage with. By using this, we save a lot of money by not sending unnessary SMS/WhatsApp/Emails.

Apart from that, their journey builder is very simple and easy to use. It even gives you the option to copy and paste upto 10 blocks which saves me a ton of time by not creating the same blocks again when creating a journey.

To end it with, they have a great customer support and CSM team who are very responsive and address your issues as soon as possible. This is very important to consider when going ahead with a automation tool.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
No product is perfect and there is always something which can be made better. I'll keep this breif and mention the key points:

- Integration time -> this took longer than expected, but again this involves the efforts from both the teams
- Creating live segment -> It takes a considerable amount of time for the segments to brew
- Analytics -> WebEngage can introduce more analytics features which will give us deeper insights

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
By using WebEngage, we are able to automate the entire customer journey from start to end.

We hvae complete control on:

- when the communications are being sent in the customer journey (trigger)
- at what time
- the number of communications
- cohorts & funnel analysis

& much more.

all_reviews.review_title: Using WebEngage as a Newbie
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The best thing about it is how easy it is to use - no complicated stuff to deal with.
Multichannel Communication: I like that I can reach my customers on different channels like email, SMS, and push notifications all in one place. The data insights are super helpful too, helping me see how my campaigns are doing in real-time.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
-Sometimes, figuring out the more advanced features can be a bit confusing. They could make it simpler.
-Integrating with other tools can be a hassle. I wish it was smoother and didn't take as much time.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Single dashboard: Before, I had to use different tools for emails, texts, and push messages. But with WebEngage, I can do all of that in one place!

Personalistion at scale: WebEngage helps me send personalized messages to specific groups of customers. This helps me get better delivery rate and CTRs.

Automation: I used to spend a lot of time setting up campaigns, but not anymore! WebEngage does all the work for me. It knows when to send messages to customers, so I can focus on coming up with cool ideas.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage: A Powerful Marketing Automation Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The best thing about WebEngage is its user-friendly interface and ease of use. Setting up campaigns and workflows is a breeze with their drag-and-drop editor, even for someone with limited technical expertise. The platform's multi-channel communication options, including email, SMS, web push, in-app messages, and on-site notifications, have been a game-changer in engaging with my customers. Additionally, the personalization capabilities based on user behavior have significantly improved the effectiveness of my marketing efforts. Overall, WebEngage's user-friendly approach and powerful features make it a top choice for enhancing customer interactions and driving conversions.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
WebEngage provides good customer support, the response time could be improved. There have been instances where I had to wait longer than expected to get assistance with certain issues.
while the user interface is generally user-friendly, I have experienced occasional glitches and slow loading times, which can be frustrating when trying to set up time-sensitive campaigns.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage has proven to be an invaluable solution for solving several critical problems in my marketing efforts, and its benefits have been substantial for my business.

Customer Engagement: WebEngage's multi-channel communication capabilities have allowed me to engage with my customers effectively across various platforms like email, SMS, web push, in-app messages, and on-site notifications. This has resulted in higher customer engagement and interaction rates, fostering a stronger connection with my audience.

Personalization and Segmentation: The platform's ability to personalize messages based on user behavior and preferences has been a game-changer. By segmenting my audience and sending targeted messages, I can provide more relevant content, leading to improved customer satisfaction and increased conversions.

Automated Campaigns: WebEngage's automation features have significantly reduced manual effort and time spent on repetitive tasks. I can set up automated campaigns triggered by specific actions, such as cart abandonment or sign-ups. This automation has improved the efficiency of my marketing strategies and allowed me to focus on other aspects of my business.

Data-Driven Decision Making: WebEngage's advanced analytics provides valuable insights into the performance of each campaign. With comprehensive data on user behavior, I can make informed decisions to optimize my marketing strategies and identify areas for improvement.

Customer Retention: Through timely and targeted communications, WebEngage has helped me enhance customer retention. By nurturing customer relationships and offering personalized incentives, I can encourage repeat purchases and foster long-term loyalty.

Integration and Centralization: WebEngage's seamless integration with various third-party tools has allowed me to centralize my marketing efforts. This data synchronization across different channels ensures a consistent and coherent approach to engaging with customers.

all_reviews.review_title: My WebEngage Journey
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
First off, the platform's user interface is so intuitive and easy to navigate. I was up and running in no time, creating personalized campaigns has never been so straightforward!

One of the standout features of WebEngage is its robust segmentation options. It allowed us to segment our audience based on various criteria, such as behavior, demographics, and preferences. This level of precision helped in tailoring our messages and offers, leading to higher conversion rates and customer satisfaction.

The ability to track and analyze the performance of our campaigns in real time is invaluable. WebEngage provides detailed analytics and insights, allowing us to fine-tune our strategies and optimize results continually.

But perhaps the best part of using WebEngage is their exceptional customer support. Whenever we faced any challenges or needed guidance, their team was there to assist us every step of the way.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
While WebEngage offers several customization options, I found some limitations in the templates and designs. It was challenging to achieve the exact look and feel we wanted for our campaigns, and the customization options felt somewhat restrictive.
Majorly the drop in WebEngage segment brewing capacity and journey trigger time is always a hurdle.
But overall benefits surely outweighed the issues we have from using the platform.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. The ability to track and analyze the performance of our campaigns in real time. - Solves our hardship of data tracking
2. WebEngage's robust segmentation options - help us better bifurcate our bases - resulting in better CTRs and cost saving
3. Hyperperosnalization of comms has helped us in improving our customer experience.

all_reviews.review_title: Webenage - A User-Friendly Platform for Creative Minds
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
User-friendly interface and intuitive navigation.
Diverse and high-quality content across artistic disciplines.
Active and supportive community engagement.
Strong commitment to user data security and privacy.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Some sections contain outdated content that needs curation.
Additional features like private messaging between users could enhance communication.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Webenage is an online platform designed to foster creativity and connect like-minded individuals from various artistic backgrounds. Geared towards aspiring artists, writers, and musicians, Webenage aims to be a collaborative hub where users can showcase their work, receive feedback, and engage with a supportive community.


During my testing, Webenage exhibited remarkable performance and speed. The website loaded quickly, and I experienced no significant lag issues. Moreover, the platform was responsive across different devices and browsers, ensuring a seamless user experience.

One of the standout features of Webenage is its comprehensive set of tools for content creation. Users can upload and share their artwork, poetry, short stories, and even music compositions. The option to leave comments and engage in discussions under each piece of work encourages a sense of community and fosters constructive feedback.

all_reviews.review_content:

2. Having the flexibility to choose various delivery partners for various channels such as email, SMS, WhatsApp.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
1. Not the most cutting edge features available in the market
2. Post-implementation service can be better.
3. Analytics can be better.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage solved our  problem of having to send campaigns manually and not being able to A/B test different content across segments.
We have now created a campaign tree which  allows us to differentiate campaign flow based on customer's response and also A/B test with various content, creatives, time and vendors.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage provides all the Analytics Data from our apps, helping us to understand user behaviour.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The data we get from Web Engage is real-time, making sure we get all the data without the risk of losing even a single ounce of it. Along with that, you can also pass parameters with your events.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
You don't get the data as per the app being used. To get that you always have to apply a filter for that particular app.
And in some cases, data gets dealyed to get uploaded on the dashboard. This puts the user in a dilemma whether the data was sent correctly or not.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Now, we can track the user journey along the app, helping us to identify the screens with major drop rate and fix it.
Also, helping us to identify the areas we need to improve in.

all_reviews.review_title: A fantastic tool for analysis and customer insights
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage is a fantastic customer engagement tool that provides a wide range of features to help businesses improve customer retention and increase conversions. The platform is user-friendly and easy to navigate, making it easy for teams of all sizes to use. The user interface is intuitive and provides a lot of customization options.

One of the best things about WebEngage is its ability to segment users and personalize communication with them. It also provides several options for triggering communication including push notifications, email, SMS, web push and more. This helps to ensure that the right message is delivered to the right user at the right time.

Another great feature of WebEngage is its ability to track user behavior and provide actionable insights. The platform offers detailed analytics and reporting that can help businesses understand how users interact with their website and mobile app, and make data-driven decisions.

Overall, WebEngage is an excellent choice for businesses looking to improve customer engagement and drive conversions. It is a powerful and versatile platform that offers a wide range of features, making it suitable for businesses of all sizes.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
I do not have personal preferences or dislikes. However, I can tell you that some users may find the pricing of WebEngage to be on the higher side. Additionally, some users may find that the platform has a bit of a learning curve and may take some time to fully utilize all of its features and capabilities. However, these are just possible cons that some users may have, but it's important to note that it can vary depending on the particular user and their specific needs.

In terms of how it benefits you, it depends on your specific needs and goals. all_reviews.review_title: The Awesome Tool for a Disruptive Startup
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
*Provides a wide range of communication channels, including email, mobile push notifications, SMS, in-app messages, and web push notifications
*Offers robust user segmentation capabilities, allowing businesses to target specific groups of customers with personalized messages
*Provides real-time analytics and A/B testing to help businesses understand and optimize their engagement with customers
*Has a user-friendly interface, making it easy for developers to set up and manage campaigns.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
*WebEngage from an android developer's perspective:Limited customization options for in-app messaging
*Lack of support for certain mobile operating systemsIntegration with other tools and platforms may be difficult
*Issues with push notifications not being delivered
*Limited reporting and analytics capabilities
*Not much control over the push notification appearance

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
*For android developers, using WebEngage can save a lot of time and effort in integrating and maintaining different channels of customer engagement. It also provides a single dashboard to track the performance, thus reducing the complexity of tracking different channels separately.
*The real-time analytics provided by WebEngage can help businesses track engagement metrics and make data-driven decisions about their customer engagement strategies.

all_reviews.review_title: Revolutionary Startup Essential: The Amazing Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage is a customer engagement platform that allows businesses to interact with their customers across multiple channels such as email, mobile push notifications, SMS, in-app messages and web push notifications. It also provides features such as user segmentation, real-time analytics and A/B testing which can be useful for businesses.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The complexity of the WebEngage platform can make it difficult for users to navigate and understand all of the features and functionality it offers. Additionally, setting up and configuring the platform can be time-consuming, as users may need to spend a significant amount of time learning how to use the platform and setting up the various features and integrations that are available.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
By using the platform's various features such as push notifications, in-app messaging, email campaigns, and surveys, you can gather data on your users' behavior and preferences, and create campaigns that are more likely to be effective

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The best thing about WebEngage is how it helps you understand your users on the web or app platform by creating unique events and the analytics feature they provide. The flow of real-time data is what makes it stand out from other competitors.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There has been very less thing to dislike as the product has been evolving by taking our suggestions but the pricing is way too high which I think they can reduce for the startups like us.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
So the main issue that this platform has sorted for us is that It has WhatsApp and IVR included in the platform along with other communication methods like SMS or Email or Push notifications. Now with better analytics, we can segment our user base as to how and with what communication method they are engaging and it helps us to increase our productivity.

all_reviews.review_title: A decent CRM platform with wide array of possibilities to customize.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
It provides easy integration for all the channels we want to incorporate, and, we can plan/customize messages through a wide range of possibilities specifically in the journey section.
Also, it helps to easily test different elements in emails through variations. (subject line, etc)

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
It feels a bit complicated sometimes when I create specific journeys and it doesn't work. I think a support mechanism that is easy to reach and that can cross-check my journeys and point out the correction would greatly help.
Also, sometimes the segment doesn't load the right number of customers as it should, not sure why.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is mainly providing both a CRM platform and a CDP tool that is helping me to quickly transfer my first-party data to my sales channels such as FB and google.

all_reviews.review_title: Decent user behavior's tracking, analytics and campaign manager tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Its user tracking on every event plus journey feature to send an automation campaign to multiple channels like SMS, Email, Whatsapp, App Push, In-App etc. In comparison to competitors its cheap with all important analytics and tracking. Its live stats feature to check users on the mobile app is also great.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Mark all small metric values in events under analytics as others. Moreover, its delivery/click report with some of its partners/integration is not perfect. Sometimes a failed delivery is shown as sent. Can't create campaign directly from RFM outcome.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can track user behavior on our mobile app and use this data to help re-target such users and increase retention metrics. I can track user behavior on different mediums on one panel/dashboard.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage makes it easier and faster to perform marketing and CRM processes
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage has helped us automate marketing in the organization and integrate customer touchpoints that allow us to track the user journey within our web platforms. Visualizing data has become easier since we have this tool, and it has allowed us to identify gaps in our workflow and find solutions as quickly as possible. Moreover, WebEngage has helped us develop a sales-focused funnel, which has allowed us to make assessments that are taken into account in the organization's decision-making regarding marketing and effective sales strategies.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Its user interface could be improved; it could add new and more creative templates, and creating segments usually takes more time than we would like.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
With WebEngage we have been able to automate several marketing tasks that initially wasted a lot of valuable time; it has allowed us to store and analyze our customer data, track detailed user journeys and develop useful sales funnels in our decision-making. WebEngage has good features, and their customer service is quite good and helpful; they are very well prepared to provide the support wheneededes.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about WebEngage?
review_question_answers.answer: WebEngage has helped us automate marketing in the organization and integrate customer touchpoints that allow us to track the user journey within our web platforms. Visualizing data has become easier since we have this tool, and it has allowed us to identify gaps in our workflow and find solutions as quickly as possible. Moreover, WebEngage has helped us develop a sales-focused funnel, which has allowed us to make assessments that are taken into account in the organization's decision-making regarding marketing and effective sales strategies.

review_question_answers.answer: Its user interface could be improved; it could add new and more creative templates, and creating segments usually takes more time than we would like.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Segmentation capabilities for targeting
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage has good segmentation capabilities where you can use user properties and actions to set up one-time or trigger campaigns. Also, saving all past data help to create older cohorts and understand the behavior.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- Limited Push templates, Should focus more on push notifications considering it's the most cost-effective channel, and differentiating factors help to gain user attention considering the number of apps the average user has on his device.
- Takes more time to brew segments as it stores all the past data

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Omnichannel capabilities with proficiency help to make the most out of each channel
- Send time optimization, Funnels, and Cohort analysis helps to understand user behavior and allows to target them on the right time with the right channel
- AB Testing, Split campaign and flow controls help use make long term decisions

all_reviews.review_title: A great CRM / marketing automation experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage allows for the creation of journeys, website personalization, drip emails, social media messaging, SMSes and many other means of communication for marketing automation.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
As such, WebEngage is a very intuitive tool to use. However, we had faced initial challenges with the Webengage team to get us started and do an initial setup. Moreover, the primary key for each user is the ID webengage generates rather than the email id or phone number of the use which may create duplicate users in the system.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Very Detailed Insight Tracking
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The Best thing about WebEngage is its detailed event tracking with User information which includes tracking the location, session duration, Unique Events etc.
We can customize the events and organize them according to our requirements.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Sometimes the tracking is a bit difficult when the site is embedded into an Iframe some sessions and page views are missed out in tracking and that doesn't give accurate data.
Example: on the main page, A license key of WebEngage is implemented for tracking and the sight in the iframe has B key attached to it then the event of the B page is not tracked in the A account, and the user data is also not visible on B account.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
It Gives a very detailed tracking and data management where we can get data about System Attributes, User Profiles, Custom Events, and much more.
We can get to see complete Analytics metrics of top events during a time span which helps in understanding the user's interest in a better way.

all_reviews.review_title: Why webEngage is important for a Business whether it is B2B or B2C
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I liked the Dashboard and the Personalization and Analytics feature very much, so you can target the consumer very deep and analyze your campaigns and journeys better from the dashboard, you can message on-site through personalization and in-app Which is some limitations in other tools but not in Web Engage

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
When you create a live segment, the time taken in it is not suitable for segment creation, it slows down the speed of your work because your journey and campaign are segment-dependent.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Working on increasing the maximum reachability to the consumer because it is very important because reaching every consumer is the objective of our campaign, this helps in growing our business and also helps in understanding the behavior and mentality of the users. When we reach the user by breaking the consumers into segments and cohorts, then we can target the right consumer with the right communication, which increases the chances of converting the consumers.

all_reviews.review_title: You can do EVERYTHING meticulously
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I love the UX of it; it's so intuitive, even if you are a beginner with WebEngage. All the sections, functionality, setting up campaigns, using analytics, creating segments. All feels natural; there's zero effort in figuring out the platform.

You have all the freedom you want, and you can quickly validate all your hypothesis with analytics and setting up personalized campaigns.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The only thing that bothers me is that sometimes it takes too long to create Live segments, and if you are making one while setting up a campaign, periodically, it doesn't refresh acc. to the parameters quickly.

To give you some context, we have around 400k MAU, and I can understand that it can take time to create Live segments, but sometimes it's a bit annoying!

Also if you create segments while campaign setting, it by default creates a live one. One time I got confused and couldn't figue why was I not able to isolate a user for testing.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using it to the full extent, setting up marketing journeys, setting up in-app notifs and PNs to nudge the users, and using the analytics to create segments that help in figuring out a hypothesis and restructure communications according to that.

Benefits as I mentioned before, you can do such powerful stuff with it, and yet the tools do not seem intimidating. As for business problems, we have seen

- Amazing open rates because we could set up journeys in such an easy drag & drop manner, and you can do all you want; WegEngage doesn't constrain you.

The integration touchpoints with SSPs are very troublesome if things go wrong and collaboaration is very cumbersome between the WebEngage tech and SSP tech.

all_reviews.review_title: I've improved retention at not one, but TWO brands with WebEngage!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage is undoubtedly one of the most effective user engagement and retention platforms. Juicy Chemistry wanted to solve specific issues rapidly, and the team at WebEngage seemed ready and eager to help. WebEngage's analytics, segmentation, personalization, and engagement channels help businesses get a 360deg view of their users, products, and campaigns. Their easy-to-use dashboard makes it simple to compare the impact of each channel of engagement. It helped us minimize efforts and maximize impact.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The team, product and the experience are such that it leaves little room for complaints. I have worked with the team as part of two different brands and there's nothing negative that I can think of from a brand perspective.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
When used with intent, the platform has a transformative impact on a business' retention efforts.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage solved a critical challenge that was the lack of access to data and metrics. While another service provider that the brand previously engaged with provided primary data and metrics, certain features remained absent such as the ability to create dynamic segments to target users better. The platform also helped us with a detailed analysis of conversions, such as the type of conversion (Click-Through, Send-Through, Open-Through) or user-level conversions data.

WebEngage's analytics, segmentation, personalization, and engagement channels help businesses get a 360deg view of their users, products, and campaigns. Their easy-to-use dashboard makes it simple to compare the impact of each channel of engagement. It helped us minimize efforts and maximize impact.

review_question_answers.answer: The team, product and the experience are such that it leaves little room for complaints. I have worked with the team as part of two different brands and there's nothing negative that I can think of from a brand perspective.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage- Affordable, effective & simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage is, in general, simple to use and understand. All marketing channels are provided in one place: SMS, App, Email, and Webpush. Creating a customer journey and targeting them across any channel is quite simple and clear. WebEngage just introduced the "Best Channel" feature, which has helped in determining which channel our customers are more active in. It has led to a significant increase in our open rates.

-Never faced any big issue with the third-party integration

-Excellent customer support

- User - friendly UI

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- Email scroll heatmap is missing
- Time taking process in making the segments

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Helps in retaining customers by sending them personalized communication
- Tracking user journey ( where exactly it ended, what time etc.)
- Based on the user's history, the algorithm determines the optimal time and channel to engage the customer.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage is filled with so many amazing features. But, for me, the best one is the Journeys. I use it for inactive users' conversion, event-based interventions, and most importantly for creating automated campaigns.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
I recently faced an issue, where I couldn't complete an on-site survey on a single page. The reason was that the survey was conditional. This issue was costing me successful conversions.

all_reviews.review_content:

I love the email editor feature the best. The flexibility provided for designing rich emailers & dynamic resizing of images does the charm. You don't need to know HTML or coding to launch campaigns

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Changing Push notifications from Text to image-based ones deletes the entire content & requires configuring all the content again.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Targeting & Segmentation can be easily done using Webengage. We have multi-lingual users & the console helps us easily segregate the users basis their preferences. It further refreshes the data hourly so that we have almost realtime data for any updated user preferences.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the best marketing automation tools out there!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage is fairly simple to use. Creating multichannel campaigns, automated marketing campaigns, integrating multiple data sources is possible in Webengage. In addition, it allows some level of personlization on website through pop ups etc.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
While using webengage, we did face a couple of challenges. The initial integration using APIs with our website and inhouse application wasnt very simple and was indeed time consuming. Second, while webengage allows website personlization through pop ups etc, it doesnt allow for on-site page personlization within the content.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Webengage was the first marketing automation product we ever used. It was very intutive and we extensively used it to create on-site campaigns as well as campaigns through emails, and other channels through their jourbeys feature. Overall, our marketing automation was completely taken cafre of using webengage.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage: The right way to engage customers for small businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Personalization. Yes, the software offers personalization for all sorts of businesses and I experienced the same. When I came across this software, I felt it was just another software for digital marketing; however, not all latest software allows email marketing & SMS marketing options with such detail as WebEngage does. Content is king but timely messages need to be shared with customers and WebEngage's scheduling feature allows just for that. It allowed my family business to grow 25% in 6 months which might appear insignificant but for a small business with 0 prior digital experience, it is just wonderful.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Although WebEngage allows several marketing options, Instagram is a platform that is ignored by it. The software needs to focus and allow more features for Instagram marketing because it is the new hub for visually-pretty small businesses. I would've extracted loads more if only I got the right features for Instagram & Twitter on WebEngage.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
WebEngage shall be used especially by small businesses as it allows personalization with minimal effort. However, I used it while I was working with MICA and then used it for my personal business which is a small-scale clothing outlet. It worked wonders for my business but with MICA, there were a lot of variables to consider which made it slightly cumbersome to use the software because I was not adept at it. Maybe, I will be able to utilise it better in a few months.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage is not a unique software as it allows timely messages to be shared with customers on several digital platforms; however, the ease of use & scheduling feature helped me cater to the problems I faced for my small business. Some of the problems were understanding where my consumer is present (digitally), SMS Marketing & Email marketing helped me more than Facebook marketing and scheduling messages reminded me as well as my customers why they should come to my shop & purchase my products. It improved my customer acquisition strategy, helped me with remarketing, and allowed me to connect with my customers on time with minimal efforts.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing platform to create targeted automations and engagements.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Dynamic event-based segment and journey to creating automation. We are able to use a lot of different channels like WhatsApp SMS email ads to communicate to users. We can run ad-hoc campaigns to quickly test our hypothesis. A/B testing is also one of the great features where we test the better messaging and send that to users. We don't have to take these decisions on our own. Data takes care of it. Other channels like push notification and advertisement retargeting cohort are also the feature that you don't get easily in one product. We are able to create segments and export them to ads if needed for retargeting.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Everything is good but sometimes it loads slowly, some more flexibility in viewing older logs and event history will definitely be a plus point. If journeys allow us dynamic if-else based on event attributes then it will make it more powerful. If we get more control over if and else conditions in the journey then it can be very helpful. Funnels are good but can be improved where we are able to see breakdowns.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
You can target users in a very effective manner using dynamic segment and omnichannel communication.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to use analytics module to quickly figure out user and event analytics, with these insight we create dynamic segment that we target from omni channel communications, by personalizing and sending right communication at right time.

all_reviews.review_title: Good experience with great tools
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Notification delivery setups were streamlined and straightforward to set up. Pretty much a plug-and-play solution with a host of customizations allowed.
User tracking is another bonus, detailed login, and user metrics as well.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
In-app campaigns are restrictive, both in terms of delivery and customisation.

All user and notification metrics do not seem to have an upper bound on the max delay that happens between a user event being triggered to it displayed on the web dashboard.

Documentation is really sparse for all firebase events that are handled by WebEngage, and how we could extend webengage's wrappers to customize them for our own needs.

Apart from iOS and Java, libraries for React Native do not have clear documentation on specific operations, with vague pointers to examples utilizing Java or Swift, which isn't of much help.

Intercepting notification payloads in RN is cumbersome though, as we needed to write bridge code to transfer payloads over. This wasn't stated in the docs, and appeared as a plug-and-play solution.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Notification delivery and user tracking are two problems that we've heavily used WebEngage for. They're highly customisable and easy to setup. Reduce a significant amount of work that's needed to get these up and running.

Notifications especially can be customised on a native level, which gives us amazing flexibility in UX.

all_reviews.review_title: Brilliant Product for App Engagement Metrics
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
For any Growth Hacker driving in-app engagement is absolutely critical for improving app session time and generating revenue. Web Engage lets you as a Growth Hacker to define user journeys and drive app engagement via strategic push notifications. Further more it lets you analyse what's working and what's not so that you can take data driven decisions.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The overall product is really good and to be honest, there is nothing to be disliked about the product. Maybe the interface can be a bit better so that the learning curve can be reduced.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
As a growth hacker, it's critical to have a product that can give you in-app data analysis and lets you take actions at run time. WebEngage helps you achieve both and would highly recommend fellow growth hackers to consider WebEngage when you are looking for a solution.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we are solving is that of app engagement. The benefits have been improved DAU, an increase in returning users, which has a direct positive impact on the ARPU of the app.

all_reviews.review_title: An instrumental tool for our CRM efforts
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Very intuitive and easy to use interface, accommodates both straightforward and complex marketing automation initiatives with intricate logic and use cases. The team is very open to feedback and willing to continuously optimize the level of support they offer.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- Segment creation can take a while, even if the number of eligible users is rather small.
- Reporting and conversion attribution can be improved - we had to rely on custom-built reports or BigQuery in order to be able to access mode sophisticated user insights
- Sometimes it takes a while between in-app user registration and the moment the user becomes visible in WebEngage
- Would be useful to be able to set some triggers/alerts whenever something isn't working as expected
- Adding annotations to the journey builder screen would also help tremendously

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activating newly registered users, driving engagement, monetizing existing users, and reducing churn. WebEngage helps reduce man-hours, automate our marketing efforts, and offer an omnichannel experience to our users.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple, thought through marketing automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
We switched from another marketing automation tool primarily due to two reasons - we were looking for a simpler interface that focuses on the core problem, and a good support/success team when issues arise. I am happy that WebEngage was able to address both of those. Its a beautifully designed product, which can get as sophisticated as we want and as simple as we want to keep it. Customer success team was very responsive and quick in giving out the solution. We started for evaluation, and ended up finalising them for these reasons.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Analytics is the area they can improve on, I feel its still limited. I really like their real time journey status on how many people are at what stage in the process, but only issue is its hard to debug when problem arises. This is something need to be improved. And most importantly, for bigger segments it takes quite a lot time to load data. Need to speed that up.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed this for marketing automation for our e-commerce website on multiple communication channels. Also, A/B testing what is working what's not and optimising the ones that are.

all_reviews.review_title: A very useful marketing automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
We adopted webengage in 2018 to automate the marketing process for our brands. The integrations to the site and other tools like ESP and other tools were fairly straight forward with a plug and play approach with their APIs. We could also easily upload legacy data to their backend through CSVs files, which made the setup very easy. Marketing automation such as email drips, popups on the website, automated API hits, etc makes the whole process very easy to manage without much training.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Webengage, as such, is fairly feature-rich.  If  I do have to point out something, it would be that 1) it doesn't have a feature that allows dynamic text to be directly displayed on a webpage, although this can be done through a popup, and 2) it uses external ESPs to send emails. It would be great if they have their own ESP service which also verifies emails to prevent unnecessary bounces.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Webengage solves the marketing automation gap with most legacy businesses like ours had. It brings in almost all features to get in touch with your client based on the interaction you had with them and helps improve enagement.

all_reviews.review_title: A minimalistic yet scalable approach to marketing automation & customer analytics.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
What I love most about WebEngage,

1. Minimalistic UI.
2. Compatibility with GTM (Love this feature).
3. Easy to configure 3 rd party service providers.
4.Powerful event-based analytics dashboard.
5. Easy to create customer journies & in-depth analysis.
6. Unique conversion attribution system.
7. Reflective campaign analysis.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There's is nothing to "dislike" in WebEngage, but I would like to make some suggestion,

1. Add Google ads audience exporting.
2. Add some more advanced customer analytics solutions like RFM, customer churn prediction, conversion probability, etc.
3. Automatically enable the winning variation for all users of a campaign after a certain time period.
4. Edit campaign content after enabling a customer journey.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
It's easy to use, understand & scale your marketing effort using WebEngage.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage helping Cashify to solve various problems across departments,

1. The marketing operation team can plan, deploy & test customer journeys in a minimum time span.
2. Content team can A/B test their content & easy personalization method helps the team to test better.
3. Illustrative customer analytics help the product & analytics team to decide better.
4. GTM compatibility helps the data engineering team deploy tags independently without being dependent on the dev team.
5. Data collected via Webhooks helps the data science team to build better models & helps taking better business decisions.

By all accounts & proven results, I must say that WebEngage is easy to use & highly useful SaaS an organization can use to streamline their marketing automation & customer analytics process.

all_reviews.review_title: A good partner for customer retention journey!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The easy navigation and using the product.

The CRM is quite comprehensive and easy to use with being new user-friendly too. Certain nomenclatures if standardized would enhance the experience further. Everyone from the Sales to Onboarding to the Customer Success Managers has good knowledge of the product and assist you to solve not only help with product understanding but assist you in a way to solve business challenges and help scale.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- The CRM needs to be made more compatible with Shopify
- The Customer Care team can be made more well-versed with in-depth product knowledge to help solve client queries more proactively.
- Different nomenclature like 'Email Accepted'. Some of the rules have to be applied on Email - Accepted and not on Delivered or Opened though that would be the usual understanding.
- The Drag and Drop Email can be enhanced a little.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
A great partner to pick for your customer retention experience. I have used a couple of other CRMs too. This is quite comprehensive even with its basic plan.  I have used WebEngage while working in a company with Lakhs of visitors and with 100s of visitors as well and the product serves both the requirements equally well. The product has gotten better while the team delivering it has continuously been proactive and helpful.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating and scheduling customer retention campaigns. They are simple and quick!
