all_reviews.review_title: Simple marketing system, saves time !!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Our company noted the great simplicity that this software has for both customers and us, especially when segmenting customers with respect to their web activity, it also has an excellent data flow aimed at travel with specialized assistance for that the clients make the best decision. In short, by using this software we had better communication with our customers.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
It does not have the value for money that we seek to offer our customers since the cost is high and would cause a discouragement in all our users, in addition to realizing that the response times with respect to the interface are relatively slow Compared to other software, they will not want to have this tool either.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Our customers like to make price comparisons before choosing their option, which is why this software is vital in this regard, in addition to providing users with notifications about constant product updates. WebEngage is aimed at companies of all sizes and therefore we invite their use and decision if they want to implement.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem we saw in our company was wanting to carry out a campaign at any time without having to depend on the help of a technical team in order to contribute new ideas, with the help of WebEngage this problem reached its end since all the supports, tools and implements that it has make it relatively easy to use, achieving the creation of a campaign in minutes.

all_reviews.review_title: 1 easy to use tool for all digital marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
- Easy to use with a simple User experience dashboard with many features.
- Helpful customer support can guide you on which best journey you can create.
- After comparison with big companies like a clever tap I find it better for me as targeting Arabic users especially in the Gulf.
-Live stats look like google analytics but more accurate that gives me Insights into users who are currently active on my app and website.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Needs 3rd party tool like AppsFlyer for knowing some metrics like how many uninstall my apps.
||-Update* I found that I can track them from the platform directly ( INSIGHTS >> Uninstalls )
Needs some HTML, CSS experience to create a unique on-site notification.
||-Update* I found that they have a dynamic (Drag and drop feature) that I can design any template without any knowledge of HTML or CSS.
Not yet integrated as per my knowledge with google ads that would help me more.
||- Update* They now integrated with Google ads and I'm testing it now ;)

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
If you decide to buy a product as Web engage I would advise you to check other competitors then decide like me I compare it with many other companies and I meet them know each feature and pricing then I decide.

if you know who is competitors just write on google Web Engage VS. and google will helps you.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easy to announce for anything on the website without any involvement of developers with great segmentation capability with easy UX any one of my team can create.
Journey designer is a great tool that helps me to build user lifecycle campaigns.
Ability to segment users for each campaign especially influencer's campaigns.
an on-site survey is a good tool that can help me use it with other features instead of using other tool like hotjar.

all_reviews.review_title: Useful for campaign automation and user re-targeting based on events and triggers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Easy to segment users based on events performed or user attributes.  Easy to create new campaigns and upload creatives. Tons of customisation available in journeys. Very useful for targeting or re-targeting customer depending on their activities. Good dashboards and easy to use. Easy to create custom events and use them in journeys

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The pricing model is quite high. As Web engage doesn't actually send emails / SMS but has integrations with other leading companies for the same, the price is a bit too much depending on the number of active users  and events you can log. Also, the event logs for users are available only for last 30 days and for earlier data you need to use a bigquery database which is not accessible by everyone on the team. It is also not possible to search for a user based on name or partial string match of email or phone number, the search just works for exact matches which can be improved. Customer support takes multiple iterations to resolve a query.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Good tool for managing communications and tracking user events, can use if fits budget.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we are solving is sending communications to leads and customers based on the activities they have performed on the website. We use this for sending promotional campaigns as well as transaction sends. The best benefit is the ability to put content like popups, events, banners and anything else on the website or run trigger based campaigns without dependencies or with minimal assistance from the tech team.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple & Easy to use - Multi-Channel Marketing Automation AWESOME
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
There are some really amazing features & services available with WebEngage.

- You can quickly learn & easily use the tool, their user guide is very clear & informative, It helps you learn some Marketing tweaks as well, which is a big plus.
-  The Revenue Mapping is clearly one of the finest features they have.
- The User Journey can be constructed very easily, with their drag & drop action triggers.
-  Customer support is always active & they support you within a day, they keep taking updates if the issue is resolved or not which shows their focus for Satisfaction.
- Awesome Account Managers - one of the finest account managers I have worked with, always listens to customer needs & always rides the Journey with their partners. Working as a team to achieve your milestones.
- Finally the funnels, great!!

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There is not really much I dislike about the tool, but of course, there is always room for improvements.

- The Analysis system can be improved, i.e data comparison, funnel filters.
- On-site notifications do not have clear insight, it's not at its best & easy as creating a push notification.
- Creating a segment takes some time, maybe this is something to look at.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- User Journey's
- Funnel Optimizations
- Personalized & Targeted communication.
- User Behaviour's
- Email Marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, flexible integrations, good customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
- Straight-forward and very easy to use
- Multi-channel integrations possible Push notifications, emails, SMS, in-app popups and even Google and Facebook retargeting can be triggered within a single platform
- Data and event integrations via various ways like API or client-side triggered events possible
- Customer support readily available

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- Predictive and AI-based personalization not possible within the platform
- Sometimes a bit slow in curating and triggering notifications
- Data visualization and analytics still a bit weak. Though it has introduced AB and multi-variate testing and control group modules etc which are very helpful

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- We are running CRM and marketing automation, transactional comms, and omnichannel journeys through WebEngage.
- It has helped us improve the user conversion funnel with triggered notifications like installs to sign-up, sign-up to the first ride, re-install journeys, etc
- Integrations have been very flexible considering we have integrated various data sources with it for each of our different services

all_reviews.review_title: Manage your sales and increase their effectiveness with this amazing platform.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
It is easy to implement API, it has good reporting panel and scheduling features, it has segmentation of users, notifications on the site are very attractive, segmenting is easy, you can create activities and set rules which is really easy, this tool has great technology integration, it has very useful and unique features of our customer journeys. We automate our marketing by defining rules like sending a push notification, this tool is not required technical knowledge, the journeys that are made through our customers.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The pricing model discourages experimentation and create hurdles in terms of on boarding, any level of user can have access to our customer data , this tool is too expensive compared to the features it has, it could improve the user interface for notifications for our apps, the SDK is heavy to integrate with the customer, segment integration can take care of that.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
It is very useful to us for the scale and development of our businesses, which is very useful when they help us target our clientele to provide the right offers, it increases us the chances of transaction or desired action by our customers. Automation saves a lot of time and efforts to our merchants for their negotiation, which are driven for their operation.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
It has CAN SPAM compliance, it has been implemented for event based activities , it has automatic responses , it has allowed us to make reports and analysis of our products and services, it has template management for marketing, it has a great omnichannel cloud based communication to our companies to be able to reach our customers and be able to in that way increase our sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Multi-channel Marketing Automation Platform & Super active customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
a) Very easy to use and the tool can be learned quickly.
b)  Customer support is very active and replies with TAT of less than a day. The resolution depends on the issue at hand, but one can bet on their dedication to resolving the issues at the earliest.
c) Customer journeys can be constructed very quickly with the help of drag and drop feature in the tool.  Many configuration options are available at the user level as well as at the attributes level, which makes user journeys hyper-personalized.
d) WebEngage has intuitive dashboards that help you in understanding the effectiveness of campaigns and take corrective actions accordingly. You can automate the reports on daily or weekly basis. This saves a lot of time of ops time.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
a) The segmentation dashboard is slow, but they have introduced an alternative for it which fixes this issue.
b) The other part being Funnel analysis is very basic. WebEngage is a very powerful Engagement tool but they have a long way to go in terms of analytics suite.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Always make a list of use cases, this will help you and WE team to understand your requirements and thus will save a  lot of time afterward.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
With WebEngage we are trying to increase user engagement in the app by automating user journeys and hyper-personalizing the content. We have seen an uplift of 5% in CTR due to push amplification and 15% in returning users in 3 months. Manual efforts have also decreased and conversion have increased by a 0.7% point basis.

The best part that I like is funnels and event based journey that reacts to real time event and help us to organize our marketing engagement pipeline interactive at every stage the user is on. Other best part about webenage is its engagement channels, webenage provides a wide range of engagement channels like sms, push, in-app notification, push, whatsapp, email, facebook, on-site. all_reviews.review_title: User's perspective after 1 year of usage
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The ease of use. Its very intuitive and simple.
It is very easy to create user segments, plan communication, create user journeys and marketing automation. We have seen clear growth in user participation since we started using webengage. It has also helped us in managing communication costs with usage of free channels like push etc.
Timely intervention on website by notification, or sms or push has also helped us in capturing sales lost in cart, or improve user engagement.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Probably more data analytics with respect to user's activity on website. As of now it provides lot of analytics with what has happened with communication and how the users have responded.
But in case we need to know what users are doing on the platform, irrespective of the communication, it has scope to improve.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation, personalised communication to users.
Managing for communication channels and creating a balance.
We are also using it to clearly drive our objectives. From curated journeys to user registration to first purchase to repeat purchase, to revival,there are  several journeys to drive user's behaviour.
Without webengage, we couldn't have achieved the kind of results. And we have just one resource managing the communication. That how easy and simple webengage is!

They even provide the best possible solution to help companies for there specific requirements which helped us to respond faster to our customers, comply with the regulations, and save on some costs and time.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about WebEngage?
review_question_answers.answer: There are times when there is a delay or lag while uploading or fetching data however, Fortunately, almost all the bugs we find are transparent to the end-user functions and workarounds are always available.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
We are using WebEngage to target our users in real-time and triggered campaigns through different channels as well as creating journeys, which actually saved our time and manpower at the same time.

It helps us in monitoring our numbers and individual campaign performance.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Multi-Channel Platform - Capable Of Handling Hyper Growth
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Ease of use with the drag and drop canvas and excellent customer care team for all queries and product strategies to best optimize processes.
It really is a very useful and fast tool to set up journeys. It also supports pop-ups and desktop push notifications built in which is a nice touch.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Some more functionality with AB Testing and the ability to build in a notifications management center for users to manage all communications channels opt in/out's would be good but overall very happy.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Obviously do your homework but overall I couldn't recommend WebEngage more, its a fantastic platform that will most likely be playing with the big boys very soon as its growing fast and in the right direction.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Complex customer journeys running over 50,000 webinars a month to have it all automated with the rest of the entire student journey.
We have reduced the level of manual work by 30X with WebEngage automation.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple marketing automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
- simple journey visualizations: easy to set up via drag and drop canvas feature
- event analytics dashboard for monitoring and optimizing
- minimal UI
- multi-channel engagement
- ability to exclude and include multiple segments
- quick and responsive support team - always following up on an open query

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- event-based segment brewing is very slow
- no logic change is possible in a journey that is adding or removing a step - get difficult to relaunch a journey as per new evolving business settings
- advanced data analytics is missing like RFM, persona setting, churn timeline, channel affinity, prediction on a dead user, win-back model etc.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- strong real-time engagement capacity
- easy to execute campaigns, cross channel
- relaunched email channel with WE and able to maintain decent reputation
- targeted communication
- reduced manual effort

all_reviews.review_title: Mastering the art of Customer Retention
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
I think so far the best thing has been the ability to come in front of the right audience at the right time with super relevant content and that too using visual workflows in no time.

Another aspect is the phenomenal support my CSM (Taffy Gill) provides, he always makes sure that we are not stuck anywhere and very smoothly helps us proceed our way to more advanced features that Webengage has to offer.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Nothing to dislike as such so far, the tool has been unlocking great potential for us consistently, still a lot to explore and master, but yeah it's on a little expensive end, that could be one factor otherwise!

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
A no brainer if you wish to level up your customers experience and keep nurturing them to make them loyal to your brand.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Couple of benefits:
1. Understanding the purchase patterns and behaviour of our customers and optimizing campaigns for better conversions.
2. Leveraging the pop up builder to capture all website visitors.
3. Maximizing repeat sales by offering codes in the emails.
4. Connecting with our existing customer base with a very targeted approach.
5. Generating repeat sales by automating reminder and miss you journeys.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage has been instrumental in bringing our multi platform channels together and work harmoniously.
The cohorts data is useful in understanding the engagement and retention of the users.
Automation of most of the engagement with Journeys and webhooks is the best

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Although the product is great and they release a lot of updates at par with global brands, there are no proactive suggestions, implementation of use cases or handholding in implementing latest product features. We would be glad if the success manager comes up pro-actively provide us with the past learnings. Maybe automated AI based insights via Email will also help.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
ROI is great
Quick Support
Dedicated Success Manager for instant doubt clarifications

Aside, make sure you know what exactly needs to be implemented post the initial launch.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able to create a unified platform for all marketing communication.
Saved a lot of manual work & improved conversion rates.
Analytics provided and the raw event data access via Big query helps to analyze the data internally.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The support team is really helpful in helping us meet our business requirements.
They help us with customized solutions that are not supported by the existing product.

Customer journeys are the biggest asset that enables us to do behavioral marketing. Its integration with APIs helps us customize our journeys effectively.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There are a few things we should definitely look into:-
- Integration of journeys with Surveys
- Having the logic of AND as well as OR configurable in the same segment creation. Currently, we do a lot of workarounds as at a time it only supports one logic.
- Improve our analytics metrics
- Events registration in the user journey path dashboard is not consistent and misses few events now and then

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the following problems:-
- Behavioral marketing; Sending marketing communication based on user inputs from CRM and website
- Optimizing our CRM processes by sending user activities via Webengage

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform to reach our customers at the right place and time!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
1. Ease of Use in terms of campaign creation, reports, event management, etc.
2. 24*7 support team availability for solving any kind of issue.
3. Innovative product features like geo-targeting, include exclude feature in campaigns, etc.
4. Third-party integration like SMS, email, etc is easy to execute.
5. The onsite notification has helped improve offer visibility for desktop and mobile web audience.
6. Journey campaigns to reach out to customers as and when they drop and to upsell and xsell with best offers.
7. Reaching out to customers with the communication of their recent search using nunjucks in the campaigns has helped improve CTR and conversion rates.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
1. Segment brewing speed at times are slow
3. Web push as a communication channel can be improved to help reach out to desktop and mobile web users.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
It's a great tool to continuously engage with your customers!

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
A 360-degree communication platform, WebEngage has helped us reach heights! We have been mostly using to send out communications. The option to create a segmented audience set and to send out a specific communication basis their recent search history has helped to improve customer engagement. Features like journey creation and reaching out to the customer as and when they drop with best offers have improved conversions on the platform. Also, other features like onsite notification have helped us improve offer visibility for desktop and mobile web audience. Overall, we can say its a great tool to use for regular customer engagement.

all_reviews.review_title: A Good tool for User Communications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
* Journeys - Can Automate User flow through pre-defined custom Journeys. It reduce manual labor.
* Relays - More powerful version of Journey, where custom business events can be setup in order to automate user flow.
* Include & Exclude Multiple segments in Communications Like Email/SMS/Push/Webpush
*Push Amplification - Increases Push Notifications Delivery

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
*In-app Experience - only CTA is clickable in screen blocker In-app, also Button is compulsory & is positioned at bottom of creative so not much can be done regarding that.
* Unable to distinguish Inapp if you are using 2 apps.
* OnSite - Most of time segments doesn't appear in onsite campaigns. also conversion of onsite are not event based.
* Multiple conversion for campaign - Not Supported.
*Can't visualize data of 2 events in one screen, in order to compare

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using webengage for marketing automation & analytics. It has helped to segment our customers & send them communication accordingly.

all_reviews.review_title: WebEngage is a good product for customer engagement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
WebEngage's platform helped us plan and execute personalised remarketing campaigns and customer journeys within a very short span of time with a good ROI. It was easy for the team to learn how to use the platform and adapt to it. The journey builder is the best feature of the platform. An increase in our MoM repeat orders to some extent can be attributed to an efficient use of WebEngage as a platform.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Analytics and attribution are not the strong enough to rely on it completely and move away from traditional in-house/third party analytics tool. Thus for business insights we still rely on other tools. The conversion tracking in case of on-site notification is only limited to URL based tracking and not event tracking.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
The integration and the maintenance are the most critical parts. Do make sure that event tracking works correctly and it does not get affected by newer releases on your platform.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage helped us in making insights actionable with a very low turn around time. Majority of our drop-offs happened on our product description page. Thus to reduce it, we started on-site notifications for ongoing offers as well as remarketing campaigns through channels such as Push, Email, SMS, On-site Notification based on reachability. Because of features like customer segmentation, we are able to send out personalised communication to each segment.

all_reviews.review_title: Great service, helpful team and an ever evolving product - one of best tools out there
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
What is like most of the ease of usability. It takes very little time to make someone new in the team to learn the tool and start making journeys and automation. User segmentation has become easier thanks to the cohort segmentation. The support team is quick to respond to issues although the resolution sometimes takes more time than required. But have seen the support team and the product evolve over the last 2 years. It is on the right track.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- Issues Resolution sometimes takes a lot of time
- Analytics and reporting can be on par with some of its other competitors. It should help in eliminating the need for an analytics team within the marketing department.
- More QBRs and insights to be shared by the customer success team which is definitely required when it comes to a SaaS product.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
NA

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Marketing automation
- User journeys
- Cohort segmentation

all_reviews.review_content:

-Ease and accuracy of setting up campaigns and reporting
-Offering consisting of multiple channels for customer reach across web, email, app

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Flexibility in creating campaigns in terms of creatives etc.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
- Build strong integration among front end, Webengage and internal data analytics
- Maintain repository of the events in terms of name, definition, implication etc.
- Use experiment capabilities such as control group, A/B testing to find out whats working for you
- Create various journeys, segments and funnels to understand more about your customer journey
- Use multiple communication channels available in webengage to make most of its capabilities

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using webengage to reach out to customers post completion of transaction with aim to drive repeat transactions and engagement. We have seen some really good results in repeat transaction performance and have obtained valuable insights on user journey, funnels and behaviour.

all_reviews.review_title: Great company and excellent product.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
It's challenging to decide whether we like the complete flexibility of the platform or the service and advice we get from WebEngage.  Both have been absolutely on par and extremely helpful to our growth strategy.  Also, I appreciate that they are regularly deploying new products and features to production.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
WebEngage is a relatively new product to market so at times you can feel their product is still maturing, but overall it's a very solid product that I would take any day to an old school enterprise platform.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
There are many good platforms available such as Hubspot or Marketo to help drive engagement, but WebEngage really packages more omni-channel marketing strategies and testing into one platform than any others I've experienced.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely user friendly. Could greatly help catapult business numbers if you're a power user.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webengage does not have a steep learning curve at all and everyone in our marketing team has mastered the basics in little over a week. Though this might be have said multiple times by various marketers, the Journey Builder is an absolute delight to work with. It allows the marketing teams to work on big-picture tasks since the daily operational activities could be automated with ease. The new drag and drop editor for emails has been a value add.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Would be delighted if we could start having staggered communications in phases to customers.
A report builder if included would add a lot of value to marketers to analyze actions that are being performed. More flexibility in the email templates is required. Waiting for the time when we could view more than 10 campaigns in a single page without having to switch pages.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using WebEngage our marketing team has been able to analyze and ensure that we get a better understanding of the cause and effect relationship between actions and corresponding results. The basic automation set up has relieved bandwidth for the entire team to think about next level actions rather than pull of daily tasks

all_reviews.review_title: A bit clunky but gets the job done
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
It makes it easy for non-technical people to implement surveys and pop-ups on website instead of asking engineers to create the code for it. It was also very easy to set up and doesn't need to be maintained.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
It's overwhelming in terms of where to start--the interface isn't too clear and it's not clear how to troubleshoot when there's a problem on the site. An engineer might have to dig in to make sure it's implemented properly.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Recommended for teams who want to implement surveys on their own without waiting for engineers to launch and test. You only need an engineer to add the sdk to the codebase.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Engineers don't have to spend their time create pop-up surveys or feedback form. Usually there's a lot of copy changes with those things so it's nice that they can edit it themselves.

all_reviews.review_title: One platform for all customer communication needs resulting in better engagement & retention rates.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Webenage is a powerful tool providing host of features for marketing, analytics and product use-cases. Things that impresses are:
1. Webengage Journeys are definitely a delight! It empowers us to reach our users across their lifecycles and communicate with them in hyper personalised ways. The tool provides lots of flexibilities and covers most of the advances use cases.
2. User segmentation  - Provides multiple ways to segment & target users across all channels.
3. Unmatched support - Webengage support team is always accessible and our customer success manager has been always there when needed.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
- There is a lot of room for improvement in analytics. Many features in terms of analytics still lack.
- Speed of certain dashboards is also slow and can be improved.
- Segmentation with events based filtering take quite a time to brew.
- Does not allow sending emails to users who have not signed up on platform.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Webengage is really a powerful tool to address multiple business and product needs. I would recommend this tool to all companies who need an automation tool out of box.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Webengage for multiple product & business use cases that have directly translated in growth in our KPIs. Few of them are:
1. Nurturing new users - Personalised communication strategies for newly signed up users to enable product discovery
2. Re-activating inactive users - Automated communications that helped us reduce churn rates
3. Improving conversion rates - Used journeys to send personalised communications in time via different channels

all_reviews.review_title: Engagement made easy!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
1. Ease of segmenting the users basis different attributes

2. Low reliance on tech once the integration is done.

3. Webengage gives you a lot of flexibility to play with communication/engagement using their journey module & can help you in deriving key insights

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
1. The analytics & reporting engine of the webengage is atleast 2-3 years behind. Pulling data for the purpose of the analysis is not easy & you need to take help of the support team to get basic data.

2. Survey module is very basic. Doesn't work properly on the mobile site. Links that you add as part of message are not clickable & you can't create integrated journeys with them which is quite bad for a marketing automation tool!

3. Funnel module is poorly built. You can analyze only one funnel at a time

4. In-app notifications are very slow even with the latest sdk integration

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. We are trying to optimize our sales funnel using marketing automation engine of webengage. It has helped us a lot in creating interactive journeys & nudge users towards their milestones.

2. Targeting users basis their behaviour & interaction with the platform has become much easier

3. Near zero product maintenance

all_reviews.review_title: Makes automation great again
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
There are all kinds of automation tools out there - rule based, trigger based, segment based, journey based, AI-ML driven, customer preference driven, and the list goes on. Some are developer first, some boast of no-developer-required integrations.

There is no one solution that fits all.

We wanted a product that helped us create manageable journeys and gave us freedom for a lot of testing. WebEngage fits that bill perfectly. When it comes to automating customer journey's - I can't think of any other tool that does it better.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Their 'Survey' module is a bit dated and lacks ease of use, when compared to other tools like OptinMonster, SumoMe or GetSiteControl. But of all the features WebEngage offers, Survey is like a Bonus that they are giving out of good will.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
If you are looking for a journey based orchestration then this is the right tool for you. It does what it says it does, and does it well. You'll be extremely satisfied if you use it to solve your communication hassles.

If you are looking for full-blown automation tool with analytics, attribution, on-site optimisation and everything that comes along, then you might be a little disappointed.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being in insurance industry, we send a lot of emails and messages. Previous products we used had a flow-chart based journey builder that used to take up lots of nodes when the journey became complex. It was unmanageable after a certain point. On WebEngage we were able to implement the same thing with 1/4th the number of nodes, owing to their UX.

Better management of states and clear reporting helped us improve upon our efficiency.

all_reviews.review_title: A complete solution for your marketing automation needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The best part of Webengage is the one-stop solution it provides to all your personalized marketing needs. You can check the user funnel, create journeys based on user behavior on your products and send the communication based on every behavior.
Moreover, the best part is the API support it has. You don't need to add fixed data, just call your API within the journey or any other communication medium to personalize the content in real time.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Sometimes it's a bit difficult to add customizations like page delay or scroll percentage which were not available till the last time I used webengage.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a growing company looking to increase customer conversion, personalized communication was a big challenge as we as a product marketing team didn't want to spam the user. Webengage's user journey came in handy at this time. Through this solution, we were not just able to grow exponentially but with such volatile and price sensitive industry our retention and conversion percentage also increased in double digits.

all_reviews.review_content:

WebEngage is designed to deliver solid non-intrusive experience to web and app users all the while increasing the client's ad slots and exposure to potential buyers, want more? You Get to segment an audience and tailor your notifications and set up landing pages and excludes ones from funnels, all this is done in mere minutes

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
nothing really comes to mind, except maybe create a gallery button to store and edit creative live, also maybe quotas need to increase

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
If you want to really scale and make use of your website white space then i highly recommend using this tool but also i advise to A/B test all formats from On-Site to In-App to Email to ascertain to the impact of each and the channels that yields the best ROI for your business. One key point is to test GIFs in addition to the regular static images, and if your website supports multiple languages then you're sure to capture the audience attention without to avoid low CTR and users ignoring the widget content, also try to analyze product ad performance to understand which ones work best with Web Engage that way you'll save your quota from depleting on irrelevant and lower performing product types, from there you're sure to master the tool and gain top notch results

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
A clear benefit is having a tool that can produce relevant product ads in a non-intrusive packaging all while requiring minimal maintenance and integration that can be done by regular Joes in marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Marketing Automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The tool is fairly easy to use. It is extremely reliable. After the initial set up we did not need any developer involvement and the marketing team was able to handle setting up of the various journeys pretty easily. I really like the omnichannel support here and we are able to target customers using channels that work for them.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
The reporting dashboard could be more intuitive. It is currently not that user-friendly and we have to do a lot of back and forth with our systems to have reports generated in the format that we can use for internal reporting. We are also not yet able to integrate with Freshsales (our CRM). Ideally would prefer to have that.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
I think it's a great marketing automation tool. We have evaluated several tools out there and are definitely happy with the choice of going with Webengage. The onboarding and support team are simply awesome and very prompt with their response and solutions. Highly recommend Webengage to anyone considering a solid Marketing Automation Tool.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Webengage, to push users through our funnel.
We also use Webengage for customer engagement and retention purposes.

This tool has helped us with not just customer acquisition but also customer retention and engagement.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about WebEngage?
review_question_answers.answer: The reporting dashboard could be more intuitive. It is currently not that user-friendly and we have to do a lot of back and forth with our systems to have reports generated in the format that we can use for internal reporting. We are also not yet able to integrate with Freshsales (our CRM). Ideally would prefer to have that.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
review_question_answers.answer: I think it's a great marketing automation tool. We have evaluated several tools out there and are definitely happy with the choice of going with Webengage. The onboarding and support team are simply awesome and very prompt with their response and solutions. Highly recommend Webengage to anyone considering a solid Marketing Automation Tool.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
We are using Webengage, to push users through our funnel.
We also use Webengage for customer engagement and retention purposes.

This tool has helped us with not just customer acquisition but also customer retention and engagement.

all_reviews.review_title: Webengage & Goto.com.pk
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
The best part about WebEngage is the simplicity of their user interface, which makes customization, customer engagement, and other things, a lot easier to do. They also have amazing customer support.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
There are not much templates for email. We need to HTML email templates.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
WebEngage has really helped in enhancing the way that we, as an organization, are able to engage with our customers on a broader level. Although there are plenty of benefits that have been acquired through WebEngage, the main advantage of the tool is that it helps improve customer relationship and the levels at which we are able to engage with our consumers.

all_reviews.review_title: Fit the bill perfectly feature-wise and cost-wise
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Realtime (or near realtime) push notifications triggered by campaigns -- highly sought after, very powerful feature.

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Nothing at all. Service has been great and features are exhaustive.

Recommendations to others considering WebEngage:
Do your due diligence with trial accounts in the dashboards for various competitors and keep in mind that they do not all offer the same feature sets. For example, realtime push notifications and triggered push notifications (something we rely upon) were rare among competition.

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending marketing/retention push notifications and in-app messages to users based on behavioral patterns, segments, and campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Marketing Automation tool to reach your custumer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about WebEngage?
Excellent Support
Simple to use system
Able to see and understand the  customer behavior
Journeys are an excellent way to engage with users

What do you dislike about WebEngage?
Complex Use Cases handling needs some assistance
Lack of Templates
Central management /reuse of messages

What problems is WebEngage solving and how is that benefiting you?
- webengage powers our complete customer retention and engagement process.
- We have defined our journeys and interaction steps which automates a lot of user tracking and sending out messages/notifications/ SMS and emails very easily
- Central management system for marketing to send information across channels
- It has helped in improving our retention cohorts
- Has helped in new user registration
- Has improved our new and old user conversion
